perturbation.original_text:
CELEBRITY will receive $6,000 per month for entire duration of the      agreement. The COMPANY will give stock to the CELEBRITY which will be      restricted for one year from issuance and will be as follows:

               Monthly Sales Volume             Stock Options                --------------------             -------------                $  300,000                    300,000     shares                   600,000                    600,000     shares                 1,000,000                    1,000,000   shares      These stock options will remain in place until certificates are issued once      volumes are met as long as the CELEBRITY maintains the distributorship by      paying the annual dues of $15.00.
perturbation.changed_text:
CELEBRITY will receive $6,000 per month for the first six months of the      agreement. The COMPANY will give stock to the CELEBRITY which will be      restricted for one year from issuance and will be as follows:

               Monthly Sales Volume             Stock Options                --------------------             -------------                $  300,000                    300,000     shares                   600,000                    600,000     shares                 1,000,000                    1,000,000   shares      These stock options will remain in place until certificates are issued once      volumes are met regardless of whether the CELEBRITY maintains the distributorship by      paying the annual dues of $15.00.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction regarding the payment terms. Initially, the celebrity received $6,000 per month for the agreement's duration. Now, the payment is only for the first six months. Furthermore, the stock options are granted even if the CELEBRITY doesn't pay the annual distributorship fee, conflicting with the former requirement.

perturbation.original_text:
The COMPANY and CELEBRITY may terminate this Agreement under the following      conditions:

     (A)  By the COMPANY.           --------------

          (i)  If during the Term of this Agreement the CELEBRITY  is unable to                provide the Services as set forth herein for thirty (30)                consecutive business days because of illness, accident, or other                incapacity of CELEBRITY Personnel; or,

          (ii) If CELEBRITY willfully breaches or neglects the duties required                to be performed hereunder; or,

     (B)  By CELEBRITY           ------------

          (i)  If the COMPANY fails to make any payments or provide information                required hereunder; or,

          (ii) If the COMPANY ceases business or, other than in an Initial                Merger, sells a controlling interest to a third party, or agrees                to a consolidation or merger of itself with or into another                corporation, or enters into such a transaction outside

               of the scope of this Agreement, or sells substantially all of its                assets to another corporation, entity or individual outside of                the scope of this Agreement; or,

         (iii) If the COMPANY subsequent to the execution hereof has a receiver                appointed for its business or assets, or otherwise becomes                insolvent or unable to timely satisfy its obligations in the                ordinary course of, including but not limited to the obligation                to pay the Initial Fee, the Transaction fee, or the CELEBRITY                Fee; or,
perturbation.changed_text:
The COMPANY may terminate this Agreement under the following      conditions, but CELEBRITY may terminate at any time without condition:

     (A)  By the COMPANY.           --------------

          (i)  If during the Term of this Agreement the CELEBRITY  is unable to                provide the Services as set forth herein for thirty (30)                consecutive business days because of illness, accident, or other                incapacity of CELEBRITY Personnel; or,

          (ii) If CELEBRITY willfully breaches or neglects the duties required                to be performed hereunder; or,

     (B)  By CELEBRITY 
 CELEBRITY may terminate at any time, without cause or penalty.
perturbation.explanation: The original section outlines specific conditions under which both the COMPANY and CELEBRITY can terminate the agreement. The modification states that while the COMPANY's termination is subject to certain conditions, the CELEBRITY can terminate at any time without cause or penalty. This directly contradicts the detailed conditions previously listed for CELEBRITY's termination, creating an in-text inconsistency.

perturbation.original_text: Assignment.  Neither this Agreement nor any right created by it shall           ----------           be assignable by either party without the prior written consent of the           other or as stated herein.
perturbation.changed_text: Assignment.  This Agreement and all rights created by it shall           ----------           be freely assignable by the COMPANY without the prior written consent of the           CELEBRITY, but CELEBRITY requires prior written consent from the company.
perturbation.explanation: This modifies the assignment clause to give the COMPANY the right to assign the agreement without the CELEBRITY's consent, while the CELEBRITY needs consent from the COMPANY. This contradicts the initial statement requiring mutual consent for assignment and creates an imbalance in contractual rights.
